More examplesFewer examplesThe economic ministers appointed were less political and more technocratic than their predecessors. Let us have a secular, powerful and technocratic leadership and not the one which you helped establish based on sect and race.The government is getting used to making decisions in its technocratic circle without taking into account the problems which affect normal people. In America, computers and telephones are potent symbols of organized authority and the technocratic business elite.This is the technocratic view, that experts' opinions carry a greater weight than other people's.
